Information From the Restaurant Offers
Description: Frank's Famous Family Restaurant is a American , Diner , and Fast Food restaurant where most Menuism users came for fun with friends , paid between $10 and $25 , and tipped more than 18% . Tags: American, Diner, Fast Food, Greek, Italian, Southern, Good For Kids, Takeout, and Good for groups Stats: 1 dish entered by diners at Frank's Famous Family Restaurant

Reviews for Frank's Famous Family Restaurant Write a review 3 reviews First reviewed by dhurstman
2 helpful votes over 3 reviews dhurstman 3 Restaurant Reviews +2
Add as friend Send Msg Frank's Famous Family Restaurant dhurstman October 6, 2008 4.0 4.0 star rating 0 0 0 0 Votes Best 'Atlanta Southside - hole-in-the-wall' Restaurant
We decided to visit Frank’s based on a Friend’s recommendation. The first time we went a couple things surprised us. How small the place was (since enlarged), and seeing several of the top Management folks from Chic-fil-A there. Then came to biggest surprise. The‘specials’menu was outstanding! For a little non-descript restaurant attached to a Citgo, just off a rather lonely exit between the Atlanta Airport and Newnan–this place was a real find. We have since been back several times and it has become one of our favorites. I once asked Frank (the Greek owner), why one of his signature dishes–the Greek Chicken–(very tender chicken breast grilled–with distinct oregano and lemon flavors served with a yellow rice that inludes very fresh Feta cheese) was so good. He responded,“because the chicken is FRESH …!”Apparently he get’s his chicken, and probably other meats and produce, for local houses.
Dishes I tried:
Greek Chicken
5.0 star rating
Possibly the best Greek Chicken I’ve ever had…! Link To Review

September 10, 2009
5 star rating
Frank's Famous Family Rstrnt is a must find.
This is the best hidden secret around. The portions are enormous. The Philly cheesesteak is delicious. The Greek salad is a must try. And the deserts are all wonderful.

I'm so excited to try it
Hello, I'm visiting Serenbe in South Fulton right now and although I haven't tried Frank's I have heard all about it! I'm headed there now and don't know if I will try the lasagna or the prime rib. Yum, Yum, Yum. Hope I have room for…
